Transparency.justification: Score = 0.5 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: 2023 INtersections Progress Report
relevantSources.summary: Dow's sustainability report mentions transparency and artificial intelligence initiatives.

Transparency.findings: Dow's public reports reference transparency and AI in the context of sustainability and operational disclosures, but do not provide detailed, verifiable transparency artifacts such as model cards or transparency notes. The evidence is limited to high-level mentions of transparency principles and AI integration.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 0.5 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: 2023 INtersections Disclosures

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: Dow's disclosures and press releases show awareness of fairness and equity in AI-enabled initiatives, but there is no concrete evidence of bias mitigation strategies, fairness audits, or published fairness metrics. The available sources provide only general statements about fairness and AI use.

Explainability.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Dow Polyurethanes fast tracks its digital transformation
relevantSources.summary: Describes AI and machine learning integration for predictive intelligence capabilities.

relevantSources.title: Dow wins FutureEdge 50 award for Predictive Intelligence capability
relevantSources.summary: Recognition for AI-powered predictive intelligence that transforms product development processes.

Explainability.findings: Dow provides concrete examples of explainable AI in action, particularly in predictive intelligence for product development. These sources describe how AI models are designed for interpretability and collaboration with domain experts, demonstrating actual explainability practices.

Human Oversight & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.summary: Newsletter discussing AI models requiring human expertise and oversight in operations.

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: Dow documents specific processes for human oversight in AI-enabled operations, including human-in-the-loop systems and requirements for expert review. These sources provide concrete evidence of accountability mechanisms and human involvement in AI decision-making.

Privacy & Security.findings: Dow addresses privacy and security at a high level, referencing cybersecurity and AI-related risks, but does not provide detailed descriptions of AI-specific privacy or data protection practices. Governance & Accountability.findings: Dow's reports and awards recognize governance and accountability in AI-enabled supply chain and technology development, but do not detail formal AI governance structures, dedicated teams, or budget allocations. The evidence is limited to general statements and external recognition.

Public Commitments & External Audits.justification: Score = 0.5 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

Public Commitments & External Audits.findings: Dow has received public recognition and awards for AI innovation, but there is no concrete evidence of AI-specific external audits, certifications, or signatory status to responsible AI frameworks. The evidence consists of high-level external acknowledgments rather than formal audit artifacts.

summary.overallFindings: Dow Inc. demonstrates notable strengths in explainability and human oversight of AI, with concrete examples of interpretable models and human-in-the-loop systems. However, most other pillars are supported only by high-level statements or external recognition, lacking detailed, verifiable documentation of responsible AI practices. There is minimal public evidence of formal bias mitigation, privacy safeguards, governance frameworks, or external audits specific to AI. Overall, Dow's responsible AI posture is developing, with operational strengths but significant gaps in transparency, fairness, and formal governance.
